pkgmetadata.longdescription:
ungoogled-chromium is Google Chromium, sans integration with Google. It also features some tweaks to enhance privacy, control, and transparency (almost all of which require manual activation or enabling).
ungoogled-chromium retains the default Chromium experience as closely as possible. Unlike other Chromium forks that have their own visions of a web browser, ungoogled-chromium is essentially a drop-in replacement for Chromium.

use.flag: Build with CFI (Control Flow Integrity) enabled
Use Clang compiler instead of GCC
Enable closure type-checking for Chrome's web technology-based UI. Requires Java and bundled binary compiler.jar in sources tree.

Patch and build the convert_dict utility. The script will be installed into /usr/lib64/chromium-browser/update-dicts.sh. More info here: https://github.com/Eloston/ungoogled-chromium/issues/188#issuecomment-444752907
Build chromedriver
Enable support for Google Hangouts features such as screen sharing
Build Ozone only with headless backend, NOT RECOMMENDED for general uses
Whether to enable ThinLTO optimizations. Turning ThinLTO optimizations on can substantially increase link time and binary size, but they generally also make binaries a fair bit faster.
Optimize parts of Chromium's UI written with web technologies (HTML/CSS/JS) for runtime performance purposes. This does more work at compile time for speed benefits at runtime.
Enable Ozone platform abstraction layer with X11 backend
Enable proprietary codecs like H.264, MP3
Build the SUID sandbox, which is only needed on CONFIG_USER_NS=n kernels
Use the system media-video/ffmpeg instead of the bundled one
Use the system media-libs/harfbuzz instead of the bundled one
Use the system dev-libs/icu instead of the bundled one
Use the system dev-libs/jsoncpp instead of the bundled one
Use the system dev-libs/libevent instead of the bundled one
Use the system media-libs/libvpx instead of the bundled one
Use the system media-libs/openh264 instead of the bundled one. If disabled, it will restrict USE=bindist.
Use the system-wide media-libs/openjpeg instead of the bundled one. OpenJPEG use are exclusively for Chromium's PDF viewer.
Use bundled tcmalloc instead of system malloc
Build with ThinLTO support. LTO (Link Time Optimization) achieves better runtime performance through whole-program analysis and cross-module optimization (highly recommended).
Enable Wayland backend for Ozone
Unsupported closed-source DRM capability (required by Netflix VOD)
